cards.back: A named container that stores a value. Examples: name = "Alice" (text), age = 30 (number), is_active = true (boolean). Like a labeled box. When talking to LLMs: "Create a variable to store the user's name"

A reusable block of code that does a specific task. Has name, parameters (inputs), return value (output). Example: function add(a, b) { return a + b }. When talking to LLMs: "Create a function that calculates total price"

cards.front: What are the basic data types?
cards.back: String (text), Number/Integer (whole numbers), Float (decimals), Boolean (true/false), Null/None (empty), Array/List (collection), Object/Dict (key-value pairs). When talking to LLMs: "The price should be a number"

An ordered collection of items. Example: fruits = ["apple", "banana"]. Access by index starting at 0: fruits[0] = "apple". When talking to LLMs: "Store selected items in an array" or "Loop through the list"
A collection of key-value pairs. Example: user = {name: "Alice", age: 30}. Access by key: user.name = "Alice". When talking to LLMs: "Create an object to represent a product"
Code that repeats. For loop: do X times. For-each: do for each item. While: keep going while condition is true. When talking to LLMs: "Loop through each user and send an email"
Code that runs only if condition is true. if (age >= 18) { can vote } else { too young }. When talking to LLMs: "If user is logged in show dashboard, otherwise show login page"

A blueprint for creating objects with shared structure and behavior. class User { constructor(name) { this.name = name } }. Then: new User("Alice"). When talking to LLMs: "Create a Product class with name and price"

When something goes wrong. TypeError (wrong type), ReferenceError (doesn't exist), SyntaxError (written wrong). Handle with try/catch. When talking to LLMs: "Handle the error if API call fails" or "I'm getting this TypeError"

A way to handle operations that take time (API calls) without freezing. await = wait for this to finish. async = this function contains waits. When talking to LLMs: "Make this async since it calls the API"
A function passed to another function to be called later. Example: button.onClick(function() { alert("Clicked") }). When talking to LLMs: "Add a callback for when file finishes uploading"

An object representing a future value - will eventually succeed or fail. States: pending, fulfilled (success), rejected (failed). Use .then() for success, .catch() for failure. When talking to LLMs: "This function returns a Promise"
Where a variable can be accessed. Global scope: everywhere. Local scope: only within function/block. When talking to LLMs: "The variable is out of scope" or "Make this local, not global"
Both mean "no value". null = intentionally set to nothing. undefined = not yet set or doesn't exist. When talking to LLMs: "Set user to null when they log out" or "Check if undefined before using"
Inserting variables into text. Template literals: `Hello, ${name}!` instead of "Hello, " + name. Use backticks and ${variable}. When talking to LLMs: "Use template literals to build the message"

Split code into separate files and use code from other files. export function add() {} in one file, import { add } from './utils' in another. When talking to LLMs: "Import the helper function from utils"
Code written by others you can use. Install with npm install lodash, then import and use. Package managers: npm (JS), pip (Python). When talking to LLMs: "Is there a library for PDF generation?"
A function that calls itself to solve smaller pieces. Needs base case (when to stop) and recursive case (call itself). When talking to LLMs: "Use recursion to traverse the tree"
JavaScript with type checking. Checks types before running to catch errors early. function greet(name: string): string. When talking to LLMs: "Add TypeScript types to this function"
Shorthand to extract values. Object: const { name, email } = user. Array: const [first, second] = items. When talking to LLMs: "Destructure the response to get just the data"
